general.headline: Supply Chain Manager * Strategic Sourcing Manager * Category Manager * S&OP Manager * Inventory Planning Manager
general.school: University of Warwick - Warwick Business School
general.description:
An Australian Institute of Management (AIM) certified  supply chain expert, armed with MBA from coveted Warwick business school,  having 20+ years’ experience in strategizing, designing and operating complex supply chains in beauty care, packaged food and health care sectors with iconic multinational and national companies such as P&G,  Goody Co. & IMC Hospital.

My supply chain expertise spans all its facets-Procurement, Strategic Sourcing, Category Management, Manufacturing Operations, Warehousing, Distribution, Forecasting, S&OP, Network Design, Inventory Planning & Optimization.   Whereas, in terms of soft skills, I excel in Leadership, Change Management, Problem Solving, Communications and Influencing. 

 I have excelled in building supply chain process, systems and people throughout my career-starting from setting up a shampoo packaging operation in my first assignment, to reaching a pinnacle of establishing full fledge supply chain capability at Goody from scratch to my latest endeavor of turning around IMC hospital’s supply chain.

One of my key mission is to establish supply chain function as a true driver and to realize this mission, I am passionate about developing supply chain talent, particularly to accelerate their ability in applying theoretical knowledge to business gains, while clearly communicating the supply chain's value. Hence, I founded my own consulting practice, to help strengthen supply chains of small and medium business.

I am also very interested in developing mental and physical strength to cope with the challenges of  work and life.  I am pursing this by via a rigorous regime of work outs, medication and Yoga.  I found this useful in managing complex changes as I transformed myself from functional expert to a business steward and have led numerous change endeavors leading to  Goody acquiring new supply chain and business systems,  and facilitating PG Arabia's Gillete and Wella M&A integration.

Provide consulting across a diverse set of supply chain domain including Strategic Sourcing, Category Management, Supply Chain Planning, Inventory Optimization, Distribution Network Design, Transportation Network Design, Warehousing, Order Management, S&OP, Category Management and Procurement.

The practice specializes in creating a robust supply chain strategy aligned with the business strategy with a clear and comprehensive plan to execute strategy.  

Other critical service offerings include Designing and Developing Supply Chain Organization, Tailored Trainings on Supply Chain functional areas, and focused training on core competencies such Behavior Based Interviewing, Business Writing, Time Management, Project Management, Thinking & Problem Solving and Creative Presentations.

jobs.jobTitle: Director Operations | Sourcing & Logistics | Market Expansion
jobs.description:
Saudi Goody is a leading multinational packaged food and beverage company with annual volume of $300 million in 2015.

SCOPE: Supply & demand, inventory, sourcing, logistics, new product development, QA, new market expansion, organizational D&D.

RESPONSIBILITIES: Design and execute best practice supply chain strategy across 5 brands, 300+SKUs, and 7 markets. Hired and developed fresh talent to staff key roles. Overcame competitive talent market challenges, with limited means to attract and retain talent.

ACHIEVEMENTS:

► Restructured supply network: 

Re-acquired 3rd party product sourcing services for $20M+ savings, creating better visibility and control of the supply base. Qualified back-up suppliers, strengthening critical suppliers and phasing out unproductive suppliers. Reconfigured supply chain inventory, lead times and physical infrastructure. Established Goody as separate legal entity. 

► Bolstered physical capacity:

I improved the short term capacity according to crop cycles, demand peaks and unforeseen events with new processes and monitoring. In addition, I established long-term capacity management by setting policy levels for infrastructure capacity enhancements (production and warehousing).

RESULTS:

•	Volume > $200 million.
•	Product availability improved 86% >98%. 
•	Expiry reduced by half 2% to < 1%.
•	Cost reduced < $30 million .
•	New products expanded by 4 brands and 50+ SKUs. 
•	New markets extended by 6 countries.  
•	Inventory reduced by 10+ days.

ACHIEVEMENTS:

►  Developed World-Class Teams:
 
•	Launched and coached the team on a robust Project Management process to spur the launch of new products. 

•	Recruited and trained 4+ staff on key roles, enabling better and sustained results across the scope of accountability.

► Drove Inventory Management Improvements:

•	Remodeled the supply chain to have the right inventory levels to drive up availability while reducing the losses.

•	Led the design and development of customized inventory management software for the entire company, a major undertaking against complex work and product context. 

•	Applied Lean principles of Loss and Root Cause Analysis to root out product shortages and delays.

RESULTS:  

•	Product availability driven up from 97% to 99%.
•	Inventory reduced by 10+ Days (45 from 55).  
•	New product launch was up to 98% on schedule.
•	Packaging artwork readiness was 90%+ right, first time.

State Manager for Victoria
Swire Cold Storage
general.description:
Career Summary:

Experience with successfully managing large distribution centres including implementing automated distribution systems; selecting, managing and training staff; developing and managing departmental budgets; establishing and managing productivity goals and leading cross functional teams on key projects. Have re-designed the layout, organization, processes and policies for large distribution facilities. Proven leadership skills gained from managing large distribution centres, leading change management programs, outsourcing facilities to 3PL, implementing Lean Thinking, negotiating major contracts, delivering supply chain projects and ensuring OH&S compliance across multiple organisations.

National project management experience including, but not limited to, the consolidation of state logistics networks into single point DC's and transition of current DC operations into greenfield DC's.

Career Objective:

To obtain a national supply chain or DC operations role (or similar) that utilizes my 18 years of distribution and logistics management experience, my Diploma of Logistics, Diploma of Operations Management and my Diploma of Occupational Health and Safety. To work with an organisation that provides opportunity for professional growth and values people as critical to successful business performance.

Specialties: I am a leader of people with strong coaching skills and experience in helping develop teams and people to reach their full potential. I have well established communication skills that are used effectively to challenge and inspire people and build trust. I am able to adapt my coaching to different learning styles. I am experienced in establishing and implementing structured performance management systems designed to provide constructive and effective feedback and measure performance.

jobs.description: Set up and manage the direct distribution model for PLASSON Australia.   Engaged in August 2014 to locate a suitable facility, fit out and prepare DC for operation, receive initial stock order and implement an ERP and WMS in order to achieve GO LIVE in a 6 month window.  In addition to our own structure there was also a need to engage with a 3PL in Perth in order to achieve an aligned go live date.  Starting with a blank canvas the DC was sourced, completely fitted out (racking, data, equipment, staff), stock received (100 containers) and staff employed GO LIVE was achieved.  Given this was a greenfield site there was a requirement not only to source a WMS suitable to operate and process in excess of 100 orders per day but also the need for new staff (all positions were NEW) staff needed to be trained in its use and in the structured processes of the set up.  Procedures, Policies and JSAs were written, training occurred prior to go live and continuous improvement has been a key to the success of the DC over the last 18 months of live operation.

•	Oversee 8 distribution facilities Nationally – 2 x Heinz operated DCs attached to production sites, 1 x Heinz facility operated by 3PL, 4 x 3PL Frozen facilities, 1 x chilled 3PL distribution centre 
•	Total pallets under control circa 110,000 
•	Coordinate implementation of new staff ensuring training is aligned with Heinz expectations
•	Conduct National Audits of all Warehouses
•	Control Financial Requirements nationally.  This includes planning budgets to be submitted annually to executive lead team. Assist direct reports in achieving budgetary requirements.  Annual Logistics budget circa $90M with strategic target set to FY15 for a productivity improvement of 5% with productivity initiatives and improved efficiencies
•	Negotiate rates with 3PLs and carriers ensure rates are aligned with forecast
•	Validate all Logistics Group expenditure 
Implement Heinz Continuous Improvement system in to Logistics Nationally - First Logistics Site globallly to align with this methodolgy (Included 5S and HGPS)
